plastic.landfill: Not recyclable here. Try to reduce single-use plastics.

metal.recycle: Crush cans if possible to save space.
metal.landfill: Check if your area accepts metal recycling.

glass.recycle: Remove caps; labels are OK. Glass is endlessly recyclable.
glass.landfill: Glass doesn't decompose. Look for glass recycling programs.

paper.landfill: Paper decomposes quickly but recycling saves trees.

cardboard.recycle: Flatten boxes and remove tape when possible.
cardboard.landfill: Cardboard breaks down quickly but recycling is better.

organic.compost: Great for organics—use a liner if allowed locally.
organic.landfill: Consider composting if your area doesn't accept organic waste.

ewaste.special: Take electronics to an e-waste drop-off—hazardous if trashed.
ewaste.landfill: Never put electronics in landfill. Find an e-waste facility.

hazard.special: Use a hazardous waste depot for proper disposal.
hazard.landfill: Hazardous materials need special disposal. Never put in regular trash.

unknown.landfill: When in doubt, use the general bin or check local rules.
unknown.recycle: Not sure if recyclable. Check local guidelines.
